title: TikTok Live Streamer/Host
description:

title: Account Manager
description:
**Role**: Account Manager

**Location**: Remote (UK based)  



  

**About:**

We're a TikTok agency that gets brands cut through on TikTok. We’ve grown our own clients and communities to over 1 million followers and have hit 600 million video views in the last 12 months. We use these learnings to help brands reach new audiences, grow their TikTok following and engagement and produce thumb-stoppingly good content


that gets cut through on TikTok.

**The Role:**


We’re looking for an experienced Account Manager to look after all client communications, building deep relationships and having the gravitas to contribute to ideas and identify client needs. You will be able to interpret briefs and liaise with relevant departments, ensuring everyone is briefed and the campaigns are delivered effectively.


This is a job for someone who knows what works on TikTok, those that can demonstrate how to get great engagement on TikTok and is also comfortable managing multiple clients.


**What you’ll be doing:**


* Own & lead account management and content creation of your client’s TikTok accounts
* Looking after your clients deliverables, immersing yourself as part of their team, as well as ours
* Brief content through our content creation process, working alongside our in-house TikTok creators, freelance TikTok creators and influencers
* Take part in ideation sessions, including our Meme Factory once a week
* Monitor, track and report on TikTok performance
* Perform research and benchmark analysis on current trends, competitors and influencers
* Attend client shoots where applicable

**What you’ll bring:**

* You'll be a TikTok expert, ideally active on TikTok yourself
* You’ll have experience working with numerous brands, in house or agency
* You'll be obsessed with TikTok and how to make content work
* You'll be very creative, and able to develop new ideas
* Massively organised, with the ability to juggle lots of clients and tasks
* You can work under pressure and be able to turn round tasks with short deadlines
* Can work closely with creatives and clients
* Very organised, with high attention to detail
* Flexible to adjust to last minute changes and forward-thinking in solving client problems that may arise

**What we can offer to you:**

Free holiday days:

* Birthday? Take a day off with using your holiday
* Moving house? Take a day off without using your holiday
* Getting married? Take a day off without using your holiday


Creative days:

* Each quarter we give you a half day off work as well as £50 towards an activity that helps unlock your creative. It could be a painting class, pottery making, a spa day, whatever it is that helps you free your mind and feel more creative!


Book and magazine allowance:

* We pay £200 towards books, audio books & magazines each year that support your development

An annual £200 budget for books, audiobooks, and magazines to support your professional growth.

title: Assistant Psychologist Brain Injury Linkworker - HMP Thorn Cross
description:
Assistant Psychologist Brain Injury Linkworker (Fixed Term Contract)
  
**Location:** HMP Thorn Cross
  
**Salary:** £26,513 per annum
  
**Hours:** 35 per week
  
Why join us?
  
  

An exciting opportunity has arisen to work as a Brain Injury Linkworker in HMP Thorn Cross.
  
Our Brain Injury Linkworker, who will be part of the Brainkind Policy & Social Change Team will work with adult men in prison in the criminal justice system. The project is funded by NHS Health and Justice England to expand the service into seven sites across the Northwest of England. This is a unique role, working across the criminal justice system and Brainkind to provide brain injury screening and support.
  
As the service is expanding into seven separate sites, when applying please provide a supporting document alongside your CV stating all the sites that you would like to apply for.
  
Please note Brainkind was formally The Disabilities Trust.
  
  

The post is ideally suited to an experienced Assistant Psychologist with specialist knowledge of brain injury and experience of working with people with complex needs.
  
The successful candidate will be responsible for specialised assessment and support of prisoners with acquired brain injury and undertake data collection for research purposes. The Linkworker will work in partnership with prison staff and external organisations within the prison and community to support individuals to access appropriate services and reduce offending behaviour.
  
For an insight into BILS follow this link.
  
  

**MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* To work remote from the supervision and guidance from a Clinical Psychologist, a Project Manager, and a Project Support Officer.
* To support and manage a complex and varied caseload of individuals within the Criminal Justice System that screen positive for a brain injury and/or have history and sequalae of an Acquired Brain Injury (ABI), under clinical supervision from Brainkind.
* To administer the Brain Injury Screening Index (BISI) to identify individuals that screen positive for an ABI and complete an assessment of needs to develop an Individual Support Plan (ISP) and planned release (or resettlement plan) for each service user.
* To ensure each Individual Support Plan is appropriately designed to complement existing Healthcare and other relevant goals.
* To implement and review Individual Support Plans with the service user and under supervision ensuring individual needs and preferences are placed at the centre of the process.
* When agreed and directed under supervision; to undertake assessments including psychometric test and neuropsychological assessments if needed, develop formulations and provide any interventions as agreed within supervision.
* To develop and deliver Psychosocial interventions on a 1:1 basis, focusing on the sequalae of brain injury.


**ABOUT YOU:**  

* An upper second class or first class honours degree in psychology
* An understanding of the needs and difficulties of people with psychological problems or other disabilities (e.g. acquired brain injury) and the ability to interact with these individuals
* Experience of working with people with complex needs
* Experience of delivering 1:1 behavioural interventions
* Experience of collection and analysis of statistical data
* Ability to communicate sensitive information in a way that addresses psychological resistance
* Willingness to work within a prison setting
* Willingness to comply with all security and confidentiality aspects of working within a secure environment


**REWARDS:**  

You can look forward to excellent benefits, including handy discounts on many brands and services.
  
  

* A competitive salary of £26,513 per annum
* 33 days annual leave inclusive of bank holidays (pro-rata)
* Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
* Excellent training and support
* Group life assurance
* Company Pension
* Eye voucher scheme
* Long service and staff awards
* Nationwide employee staff discounts incl. eating out and shopping


We also put a big focus on employee wellbeing and support. It matters to us that you feel at your best. Career development is a priority. We will ensure you get all the training and learning opportunities you need to achieve your goals.
  
  

To join our friendly team, click the Apply Now button.
  
This is a fixed term contract until 28th February 2027 with potential for extension.
  
This position is subject to a Disclosure and Barring Service check and Prison clearance. If you are interested in this position the please contact Elizabeth.wilce@brainkind.org or beth.gore1@brainkind.org. The closing date for this position is 3rd April and interviews to be confirmed.
  
  

\\*\\*Please note we will be shortlisting and interviewing candidates on a rolling basis until the role is filled therefore, we recommend applying as soon as possible. \\*\\*
  
  

* All successful candidates are subject to compliance checks including 3 years of checkable references and DBS/PVG checks\\*


Brainkind are a Disability Confident Employer. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy. Brainkind is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive organisation. It is a place where we recognise, celebrate, and live our values which includes offering a range of inclusive employment policies and staff engagement forums to support employees from all backgrounds.

Able to offer new solutions to problems outside of set parameters and to construct and provide recommendations. Coordinates with Tax, Treasury, Transfer Pricing, OTR Finance, Controllership and other functions to obtain instructions and necessary validation before bid submission, including but not limited to: terms and conditions, margins, provisions, customer requirements, guarantees and payment securities, cost estimates, manufacturing inputs and cash flow.

* Acts as owner of ITO Trade Finance Instruments with the business line, negotiating wording, format, amount and conditions of such documents. Also manages the opening and timely closure of ITO bonds and guarantees with Treasury and Customers.

title: Local Property Expert
description:
**Local Property Partnership Representative – Manchester**  
(Freelance | Flexible Schedule | Commission-Based)

**Location:** Manchester City – You must be based in Manchester or the surrounding area to apply.

**This role focuses exclusively on HMO properties for rental purposes only — not for buying or selling. Our properties are let to students and professionals.**

**About Us**

We are a growing property marketplace operating in key UK cities, including Manchester. Our work focuses on the long-term management of residential properties under company lets, specifically for co-living, student, and professional rental markets.

We collaborate directly with landlords and letting agents who hold residential portfolios and are open to flexible, high-occupancy property strategies. As we expand our coverage in Manchester, we are seeking **local representatives** who can open collaboration opportunities by **arranging property viewings** through letting agencies.

**The Role: What You’ll Be Doing**

As a **Local Property Partnership Representative**, your role is to act as the **first point of contact** between our company and letting agencies in Manchester. Your goal is to speak to agents, explain our company let model, and secure in-person property viewings for our internal team.

This is **not a sales or closing role**. You are not expected to attend the viewings or sign contracts — your job is to open doors, warm the lead, and trigger an actionable next step (viewing).

You will:

* Identify and contact letting agencies operating in Manchester (in person, by phone, or through local networks)
* Introduce our property management model and collaboration offer
* Secure **a confirmed property viewing appointment** with the letting agent
* Submit viewing details to our internal team for follow-up
* Receive payment once **3 or 5 verified viewings** have been completed through your outreach

**What You’re Offering Letting Agents**

* A professional, hands-off management model
* Guaranteed rent potential under company let
* Full property marketing, tenant placement, and management services
* A starting trial with one property (no long-term commitment required)

Agents you speak to are not being asked to sign anything or commit to a deal upfront — only to arrange a viewing with our internal property team which is a potential to work together. The viewings must be classified to serve the company let purpose (not just a general property tenant inquiry)

**What We’re Looking For**

This is **not an entry-level job or a learning opportunity**. We are only looking for individuals who are self-motivated, professional, and have the confidence to communicate with letting agents.

**You must be:**

* Based in Manchester and have knowledge of local property areas
* Confident speaking to professionals over the phone or in person
* Reliable, responsive, and able to follow up without supervision
* Interested in property, lettings, negotiation, or relationship-building
* Comfortable working independently and being paid per output (not per hour)

This role is ideal for:

* Individuals currently working in property or real estate
* People in flexible freelance roles looking for additional income
* Sales or business development professionals who enjoy local networking
* Ex-letting agents or property assistants with agency contacts

**Compensation & Payment Details**

**Compensation:**

* £250 per 3 verified property viewings arranged and completed
* £450 per 5 verified property viewings arranged and completed
* Payouts are made upon internal confirmation of viewings conducted via your outreach

This is a **freelance, output-based role.** You are paid in bundles based on completed results, not for calls or introductions.

* **Bundle 1:** £250 upon completion of 3 verified viewings arranged through your leads
* **Bundle 2:** £450 upon completion of 5 verified viewings
* Viewings are verified by our internal team through letting agent confirmation and attendance by our staff
* Payment is released within **5 working days** of verification or viewings done whichever comes first.

**You are not paid for:**

* Conversations without a confirmed viewing
* Verbal interest without agent follow-up
* Self-booked viewings not passed through our internal system
* Actual Viewing taken place
* Evidence of the above in writing from stakeholders.

**What Support You’ll Receive**

* A short onboarding call to align on goals and expectations
* A pitch outline and conversation framework
* Our branded intro PDF to send to letting agents
* A simple tracking sheet to log your activity

You will NOT be micromanaged. This is a high-trust role — we work with professionals who take initiative.

**Application Instructions**

**Please read carefully before applying.**

We are only accepting candidates who:

* Are based in Manchester
* Understand this is not a salaried position
* Have strong communication skills and local property knowledge
* Are serious about committing at least a few hours per week to this role

**To apply, please send the following to hr@thekarnani.com:**

* A brief cover letter or email (1–2 paragraphs) introducing yourself and explaining your connection to the Manchester property market
* Your CV or LinkedIn profile
* Optional: Any prior experience in letting agency work, property visits, or business development

This is a **results-based freelance position** for candidates who want to build local property relationships and earn supplementary income based on real, simple deliverables.

If you're confident you can start conversations, explain our value, and bring in verified viewings — we’d love to hear from you.

Hain Celestial is currently recruiting for a **VMO Analyst** to join our Global Business Services team on a fixed-term contract. This is a remote position, offering flexibility to work from home with occasional visits to our Leeds or Cambridge offices for collaboration. As a VMO Analyst, you will be responsible for driving operational excellence in our Vendor Management Office (VMO), ensuring contract compliance, process efficiency, and continuous improvement. You will work closely with procurement to manage and maintain third-party vendor performance, ensuring alignment with our business objectives.



This role is ideal for an individual with strong analytical skills, a structured approach to process documentation, and previous experience in vendor management or procurement.





**Key Responsibilities:**
* **Vendor Management Operations**: Oversee and execute operational VMO activities such as contract volume tracking, pricing updates, and supplier onboarding.
* **Data Analysis**: Assess data needs, identify data sources, extract and analyze data to provide meaningful insights that inform business decisions.
* **Quality Frameworks & SLAs**: Define and implement quality frameworks and SLAs to ensure vendor performance aligns with business objectives.
* **Process Documentation**: Develop, document, and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) and job aids.
* **Stakeholder Management**: Plan, coordinate, and lead meetings with internal and external stakeholders, ensuring timely follow-ups and actionable outcomes.
* **Continuous Improvement**: Identify opportunities for process improvement within vendor management and implement necessary changes.
* **Vendor Relationship Management**: Manage and maintain relationships with third-party vendors to ensure adherence to agreed terms and service levels.

**What You Will Need:**
* **Experience:**


	+ Previous experience in a Vendor Management Office (VMO), ideally within the food or Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) sector.
	+ Proven experience working with third-party vendors in a vendor management or procurement function.
	+ Preferred: Experience in CPG Purchasing, Procure-to-Pay (P2P), or Accounts Payable (AP).
* **Key Skills & Capabilities:**


	+ Strong communication skills, with the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels.
	+ Excellent presentation skills, capable of delivering insights and influencing decision-makers.
	+ Proactive and solution-oriented, with a natural aptitude for problem-solving.
	+ Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities.
	+ Ability to stay calm under pressure and manage workloads effectively.
	+ Analytical skills, with the ability to extract, interpret, and present data-driven insights.
	+ Experience in process documentation, including creating SOPs and job aids.
	+ Demonstrated ability in defining and implementing SLAs and quality frameworks.
	+ Strong proficiency in the O365 suite of tools and apps.

**Additional Information:**
* This is a **remote role** with occasional visits to our **Leeds or Cambridge offices** for in-person collaboration.
* The contract is initially for **6 months**, with the potential for extension based on business needs.


**What can we offer you?**


* Competitive salary / rate of pay
* 25 days annual leave, plus 8 Bank Holiday
* Option to purchase additional annual leave
* A day off work to support our charity partners
* Flexible working options
* Pension
* Medical benefit
* And access to a HUB that offers many discounts from a range of suppliers and retailers

description:
### **Working** **with us**


It’s our mission to provide the most advanced and highest quality manufacturing and production facilities in the UK. With an ambitious growth plan, enabled by our industry-leading international experience and the most innovative, sustainable technologies, we bring a team of industry professionals who will grow with the business and a commitment to developing sites with a rich heritage of their own.


  
### **Sales Executive**


Shotton Mill


An exciting opportunity now exists to join Shotton Mill (Containerboard) as the **Sales Executive**.


Shotton Mill is currently repurposing the site in order the build the biggest containerboard and tissue campus within the UK & Europe. This includes containerboard production with a capacity of 750,000t. As well as this, a new CHP and effluent treatment plant are also being constructed. Site wide there will be a requirement to double the current workforce by start-up in 2025. In order to achieve our ambitious targets, we need to build a dynamic Sales team capable of developing a strategy to build and generate the commercial side of the business.  

This role will report directly to the General Manager.  

#### **What you'll do:**

* Leading the development and implementation of the Eren Sales strategy for Shotton Mill Ltd.
* Developing, building and understanding the road map and sales business in order to build a network with key customers both locally and internationally.
* Developing and supporting all aspects of Erens’ global strategy of customer engagement and commercial relationships in order to develop the business within the UK and Europe.
* Leading and supporting in the development, implementation and recruitment of a UK Sales team in order to achieve Sales targets and objectives.
* Developing key focus areas, targets, procedures and objectives in order to secure market growth within the UK and beyond.
* Understanding the customer base, contacts, networks and key stakeholders by attending Sales seminars, conferences etc in order to develop and grow the Eren/Shotton brand.
* Building and growing relationships with key stakeholders and develop a partnership approach to increase Eren/Shotton Mill market share.
* Embedding robust processes and systems to develop world class sales operations ensuring customer relationships and satisfaction are maintained at every level.
#### **Professional Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in either Sales, Manufacturing or paper making is essential.
* Minimum 5 years’ previous experience working at a senior sales team lead ideally within containerboard/papermaking business.
* Ability to communicate clearly, persuasively and network with key partners is essential.
* Highly motivated, agile, results driven with the ability to problem solve are essential.
* Ability to work under pressure, with a logical, systematic manner.
* Team leader experience or ability to lead a team.

#### 

#### **Working Condition:**

  


The role will entail visiting customers and key stakeholders within the UK and overseas as required. The ability to work from home, Shotton site and visit customers is essential.  

Car driver essential.
  
### **Development**


Eren is looking for skilled and engaged individuals who want to develop and grow their skills. Teamwork is fundamental in all we do. We want to build diverse teams who want to continue to develop and grow their skills to support the business, to deliver results through advanced lean practices and state of the art assets. The current development is just phase one of an ambitious growth plan in the UK.


  
### **Apprentices/trainee**


As an Engineering Apprentice at Shotton Mill, you will gain technical, hands-on skill with our most experienced engineers on site, many of whom started as apprentices themselves. You will gain workplace experience and knowledge whilst gaining your qualifications and attending college. As the repurposing project gets underway, you will work alongside our engineers in doing the work to ensure the project is successful. You will be encouraged and guided with your learning, with ample support on site to aid with your development.


  
### **Caring** **community**


Our local recycling and energy generation initiatives not only enhance our efficiency, but also benefit our local communities.
  

  

We are passionate in our commitment to rejuvenating communities that each have a rich heritage of their own.
  

  

This understanding allows us to align the needs and ambitions of communities around our sites with those of the company — in a virtuous circle that benefits all.

It is Shotton Mill Limited’s policy to recruit employees to meet the developing needs of the organisation using professional, thorough, and fair procedures. To recruit people who are, in its opinion, best qualified to fill its requirements having regard to company standards and the potential value of candidates to the company. We endeavour to promote internal applicants wherever possible and give existing employees every opportunity for career development and ensure the best person for each vacancy regardless of sex, race, creed, age, disability, marital status and political beliefs.

title: Principal Marine Consultant
description:
### **About The Role**


Are you an experienced marine consultant with a passion for leading and delivering high-quality environmental projects? Do you have a strong technical background in marine ecology assessments, including EIA, HRA, and WFD, and a desire to shape the future of a growing consultancy team? Have you got the leadership skills to mentor and develop others while driving business growth and expanding client relationships? We are looking for a skilled marine ecologist to join our marine consultancy team, playing a key role in delivering high-quality, innovative, strategic and specialist consultancy services to our clients.



As Principal Marine Consultant, you will lead on high-profile marine ecology projects, ensuring excellence in technical delivery. You will play a key role in managing tenders, interpreting ecological data for the purposes of impact assessment, liaising with key stakeholders, and producing and reviewing reporting outputs to contribute to the development of APEM Group’s capability and capacity in the marine sector.



Success in this role means taking an active leadership position, shaping business strategy, and expanding APEM’s marine ecology capabilities across the UK and beyond. You will have the opportunity to attend and present at conferences, engage with clients and stakeholders, and drive new business opportunities while maintaining the highest technical standards. You will apply your knowledge of marine benthic species and habitats, combined with a deep understanding of environmental legislation and assessments, to oversee and quality-assure outputs while mentoring and developing the team. Your ability to manage projects, balance financial considerations, and oversee a team of consultants will be key to driving continued growth and success.



To excel in this role, you will need extensive experience leading marine ecology projects, including conducting and coordinating EcIA and EIA inputs alongside a detailed understanding of marine invertebrate species and benthic habitat classification systems. A background in business development, client engagement, and stakeholder management—including working with statutory nature conservation bodies—is essential, as is experience managing large-scale projects with financial oversight. Strong report writing and technical review skills are crucial. Ideally, you will have an MSc (or higher) in an environmental or ecological subject, experience coordinating full marine EIAs and a range of different types of ecological assessments. Previous line management experience, membership of a relevant professional institute, knowledge of statistical analysis software such as PRIMER and GIS skills are also desirable.



You will be offered the chance to work on a variety of projects, many of our employees have worked on projects that have been of personal interest to them. We match this with a commitment to continuous development and learning to support your career. We also offer benefits to look after you, from private medical insurance for all employees, access to mental health first aiders and comprehensive income protection if you cannot work. We also offer superb flexible working options, balancing work with your life.


**Next steps**



We are focused on creating a diverse and inclusive team. If you can’t tick every box on our job description, then we are still keen to hear from you and are open to supporting your development. That may be working part time or supporting you to gain experience in a specific area – we are a growing company and are able to adapt roles to reflect individual skills.


If you think you have what it takes to join our fast-growing business, then please apply immediately on our website. All we need some basic information and your CV, we will review all applications quickly and will respond to all applications.

### **About Us**


The APEM Group is a global environmental consultancy, we work with a range of clients including large corporations and governments to help them understand and solve a wide variety of environmental projects in the UK and globally. Our successful pioneering work has enabled us to grow and combine forces with other businesses who share our ethos and integrity. At our core, our people are working towards the protection of the environment across the globe.

description:
**OUR HIRING PROCESS:**


* We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
* We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
* At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
* From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.  

  

INFUSE is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy
  

At Infuse, we help brands connect with their next best customer through data-driven strategies and full-funnel marketing solutions. Our Customer Success (CS) team is at the heart of this mission - building strong client relationships and driving long-term success. We're looking for an Account Growth Manager to join our team and help scale our impact by ensuring we maximize growth opportunities across our client base.



About the Role



The Account Growth Manager plays a key role in ensuring the CS team is proactively driving incremental revenue, optimizing internal processes, and holding teams accountable for tracking growth opportunities. This role will be instrumental in automating and improving efficiency in tracking incremental revenue, identifying process enhancements, and influencing training and best practices across the team.



If you're passionate about driving growth, efficiency, and collaboration, this role is for you!



Key Responsibilities:


* Track Incremental Growth: Produce reports and track trends regularly
* Accountability & Process Optimization: Collaborate with the CS team to efficiently report on expansion opportunities
* Automation & Efficiency: Identify and implement tools or processes to automate tracking and streamline workflows.
* Strategic Influence: Continuously evaluate and enhance how we track, measure, and forecast account growth.
* Training & Enablement: Partner with the Sr. Director of Account Strategy to develop training programs
* Collaboration with Sales & Marketing: Work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Operations to ensure alignment on growth strategies, client expansion opportunities, and seamless execution.
* Data & Insights: Leverage client data, market trends, and internal feedback to refine the CS playbook for revenue growth.


What We're Looking For:


* 3-5 years of experience in Customer Success, Account Management, or Revenue Operations, ideally in a B2B marketing, SaaS, or agency environment.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to track incremental revenue, analyze trends, and identify growth opportunities.
* Experience working with CRM tools (Salesforce, HubSpot, etc.) and reporting dashboards.
* Ability to influence without direct authority, ensuring best practices are followed across teams.
* A proactive, problem-solving mindset with a passion for efficiency and process improvement.

description:
Be Part of Something Awesome - Be a Children's Science Presenter!

A unique job that you will never forget. Enjoy entertaining and educating children by making sweets and slime and earn a great income while having fun!

No particular background in science is required as full training is provided. Enjoying working with children is far more important. Looking for people right away!  
Communicate science to children in new and innovative ways. Hours are flexible but the majority of work will be at weekends with only occasional weekday opportunities. The role would be perfect as a part time opportunity.

A Typical Event  
You will travel direct from home (no commuting to the office!) to a pre-booked science event in your locality and present science programmes to around 15 children aged 7/8. * Enjoy engaging and capturing the imagination of children!
* A CRB Check (Criminal Records Bureau)
* Previous experience working with children
* 100% Reliable!

title: National Account Manager
description:
### **About The Role**


Are you ready to take on a dynamic role where you can drive profitable business growth within a defined key account base? At Arco, we are seeking a talented and experienced National Key Account Manager to join our team and play a crucial role in delivering exceptional service while maximizing revenue.  

  

As a National Account Manager, you will take ownership of one of our national accounts in the North West of England, with revenue around £7 million . Your key responsibilities will revolve around delivering budgeting, creating detailed Account Plans, and fostering strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders to maximize effectiveness.

Due to the location of the customer's sites you must be a commutable distance from the North West of England, ideally around Lancashire, West Yorkshire, Merseyside or the surrounding counties.  

  

Key responsibilities:  

* Completing a detailed Account Plan and orchestrating input from all internal and external stakeholders to ensure maximum effectiveness.
* Using Account plans deliver a best-in-class service proposition for each customer ensuring the focus is on Revenue Generating Activity
* Developing strong customer relationships with multiple contacts in each customer to maximise delivery of the full Arco proposition and expose all customers to the full Arco proposition.
* Defining and executing the Business sales strategy in order to deliver profitable growth and maximum return from each customer.
* Effective utilisation of sales methodology to prospect for and successfully acquire new, defined business opportunities.
* Driving your personal development plan in order to be an expert with our Strategic accounts, and knowledgeable in your sector

On top of working for the UK’s leading integrated health and safety experts, you’ll also receive:  

* A competitive starting salary plus uncapped commission
* 32 days holiday inclusive of bank holidays, plus the option to purchase up to 5 more days
* 2 fully paid Community Volunteering days every year
* An excellent pension and salary Life Assurance scheme
* A huge range of high street retailer discounts to help with cost of living via MyArco Perks
* Free, 24-hour access to our Employee Assistance Programme
* Access to our Learning Management System, to support your personal and career development
* Long-term service awards – we’re proud to have employees who have worked for us for 40 years

The ideal National Account Manager will be/have:  

* A proven track record in national account management, sales and profit generation
* Excellent negotiation skills, comfortable in dealing with complex corporate accounts.
* Strong understanding of the drivers of key account relationships and proven ability to demonstrate value added propositions.
* A comprehensive knowledge of market and competition
* Ability to analyse detailed sales and P&L data to inform sales strategy, utilising all available sales and reporting tools.
* Excellent presentation skills to be able to present the benefits and services of Arco to a large audience.
* Proven track record in delivering results through matrix management.
* High situational awareness in order to adapt sales methodology (ie Challenger Sales)
* Excellent knowledge of Arco products, services, customers and suppliers

### **About Us**


With a 140-year legacy, Arco are recognised as the UK's leading safety experts. As the only integrated safety products and services business, our size, scale and reputation in the sector are why we have such an impressive portfolio of accounts and customers. We're the expert safety partner with a unique mix of specialist expertise and practical real-life industry knowledge.  

  

We are now on a transformation journey to become more profitable and sustainable, with investment into our growing business to help achieve this. This is an exciting and demanding time for the business. There is opportunity to shape and challenge the transformation journey and future growth, while balance the pressure to deliver sales growth and financial targets that are necessary to support the future growth. Our behaviours; Care, Collaborate, Perform and Deliver, are embedded within our culture, to drive performance and ensure we succeed together and are rewarded for that shared success. Because It’s on us. To deliver. Together.  

  

Diversity and Inclusion at Arco means understanding everyone's views and giving colleagues a sense of belonging. We respect and value individuals for their unique skills, experiences and ideas; to ensure we can be at our best. By creating a supportive and inclusive environment we will be an organisation able to drive our strategic goals, attracting and developing great people to be a more profitable and sustainable business for generations to come.  

Be Safe, Be Yourself, Be Your Best.

title: Remote Sales Executive
description:
Ready to take your sales career to a new level where your impact will drive the future of power management? Eaton offers a dynamic, supportive, and inclusive environment that values your skills, your drive, and your hunger for success. You'll be at the forefront of creating solutions that help businesses and communities manage their power more intelligently, safely, and sustainably. Joining Eaton means you're not just selling products – you're selling a brighter, more efficient, and sustainable future.

  

As a result of internal promotion, we have a new exciting opportunity for an **Remote Sales Executive** to join our highly successful Inside Sales team. We're looking for a dynamic sales professional focused on virtual selling, leveraging Eaton’s digital tools and CRM systems to achieve sales targets. This role, suited for a proactive business development professional, involves using data analytics to conduct virtual outbound prospecting/account management/customer meetings and, when necessary, on-site visits. This is an ideal development opportunity for an ambitious professional who is looking to develop their career with a market leading global power management company.

 **This position is Remote ( based in North of the UK). There will be customer travel required, around 20% of the time and 1-2 monthly team meetings in Slough.**

**What you’ll do:**
-------------------


* Drive sales growth through your target accounts to exceed quarterly targets and grow market share
* Plan and execute your account based sales plan focusing on key activities to build pipeline and continuously improve win rates
* Provide insight into demand you are creating by actively maintaining CRM data
* Proactively identify, target and acquire new customers which is focused around our growth strategy.
* Actively support competitor cross selling opportunities to grow Eaton Market share.
* Follow up on leads and provide ongoing information to lead management process
* Understand share within your accounts, define displacement actions and activities with agreed targets
* Be motivated by continuous improvement and strive to constantly exceed customer expectations
* Data driven – be able to understand data, draw conclusions and make recommendations on how we should adapt based on what we are seeing
* Driving Eaton’s sales pipeline
* Working in a strategic manner developing account plans to maximise the influence and opportunity
* Cross Sell to drive new business opportunities
* Gathering, identifying and reporting customer and market information on new or prospective product
**Skills:**
-----------


* IT literate
* Experience in this field would be an advantage but not essential as full/ongoing training will be provided'
* Resilient, energetic, efficient, curious, rapport building, strong interpersonal and communication skills
**What we offer you:**
----------------------

* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Challenging projects in dynamic collaborative team
* Great company benefits
* We make your aspirations matter – Eaton encourages internal promotion, whenever possible
* We make your growth matter - We invest in our employees for the long term – not just with salary and benefits, but with ongoing learning and development opportunities made available through Eaton University
* We make your contributions matter - reliability, safety, efficiency, and sustainability are at the core of our dedication to improving people’s lives and the environment through power management technologies
* We make your wellbeing matter – We put your health and safety first. Wellness at Eaton is more than a program, it’s about changing the environment by offering the right tools to help empower employees to make that happen

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law.
